title: Did EU pact spur the United States to wrap up a trade deal with India?
content: There are strong reasons why India and the US should have strong trade ties. Each has comparative advantages and they have complementarities that explained the hope that the first trade deal under Trump 2.0 will be with India. But, things went haywire for reasons not related to trade: India‚Äôs refusal to engage Trump‚Äôs claims on Operation Sindoor and the pressure on him domestically to appear tough on Moscow resulting a 25% secondary tariff for India‚Äôs purchase of Russian crude.

title: Agriculture, dairy shielded in India-US deal; trade pact in weeks
content: As a result, cereals, maize, soybean and genetically modified food may be kept out of the bilateral trade agreement, which has been in the works since last Feb. Goyal said that Modi had managed to secure a very good deal for India, which was better than what US had offered to some other competing countries. Indian and American officials are currently engaged in drafting a joint statement which is expected to be finalised in the next few days.

title: World recognising India‚Äôs strength: PM Modi to NDA MPs
content: Addressing the BJP-led NDA parliamentary party meeting where he was felicitated for India‚Äôs trade agreements, including with EU and US, Modi said India is at the centre of an uncertain world as past alliances give way to new alignments, emphasising that the new year has been particularly encouraging for India, sources said.

title: Rahul claims PM is ‚Äòunder US pressure‚Äô, ‚Äòselling away blood & sweat‚Äô of farmers
content: Rahul Gandhi said the case against Adani basically targets the PM because the business leader represents the financial structure of Modi and BJP, while the US has not yet released the full material they have on Epstein Files. ‚ÄúThese are the two pressure points, and the country should understand that the PM is compromised,‚Äù he told reporters.

title: Adani arm ties up with Italian firm to build copters in India
content: The MoU was signed in the presence of defence secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh and A Anbarasu, DG (acquisition) in the department of defence (MoD), who called the collaboration a ‚Äústrategic marriage‚Äù. It comes just a week after the Adani company and Brazilian aerospace major Embraer announced a strategic collaboration for setting up a fixed-wing aircraft manufacturing facility in India.

title: AI Competition: DeepMind CEO says tech veterans calling race most intense ever
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis calls the current AI race the most intense in tech history.  He notes Google is now faster at shipping AI products like Gemini.  DeepMind is central to Google's AI strategy, working daily with CEO Sundar Pichai.  Their goal is to achieve artificial general intelligence first, fast, and safely.

title: Willow by Cricbuzz to stream Team USA T20 World Cup 2026 matches free on YouTube
content: Willow by Cricbuzz has announced major updates for the 2026 season, including free streaming of all four Team USA matches at the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup on YouTube for the first time. The platform has also partnered with Jomboy Media for creator-led alternate telecasts and unveiled a revamped, faster viewing experience across its apps and devices.

title: Govt collects health cess, but spends less than it did earlier
content: When the health cess was introduced, the understanding was that it would boost health expenditure by topping up what the govt was already allocating. Clearly, that has not happened. Instead, cess is masking what would otherwise be a steep cut in the share of health in total Budget and in GDP. From 0.32% of the GDP in 2019, the year before Covid struck, the share has fallen to 0.27% even with the cess component.

title: Tariff-ic reset? US‚ÄìIndia pact announced ‚Äî what's clear, what's not
content: India and the US have struck a landmark trade deal, significantly reducing US tariffs on Indian goods to 18%. This agreement aims to boost economic cooperation, with India committing to increased US imports, including energy. Sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy remain protected, marking a positive development for bilateral ties.

title: Oracle makes a public clarification on the deal that could end up in 30,000 job cuts
content: Oracle is defending its substantial AI partnership with OpenAI amidst reports of potential job cuts to fund infrastructure. Despite a stalled Nvidia deal, Oracle remains confident in OpenAI's funding capabilities. However, the company's massive debt and market cap decline raise investor concerns about its ambitious AI spending plans.

title: US Navy shoots down ‚Äòaggressively approaching‚Äô Iranian drone in Arabian Sea
content: The shootdown came within hours of another confrontation in the region, during which Iranian forces harassed a US-flagged and US-crewed merchant vessel transiting the Strait of Hormuz, according to the US military. US Central Command said the Shahed-139 drone was downed by an F-35C fighter jet operating from the Abraham Lincoln, which was sailing roughly 500 miles (800 kilometres) from Iran‚Äôs southern coast at the time. The statement added that no American personnel were injured and no equipment was damaged.

title: Why Trump administration is still imposing 18% tariff on India - Explained
content: The US will reduce tariffs on most Indian goods to 18% from 50% as part of a new trade agreement, aiming to address the large trade deficit. India has agreed to cut tariffs on a range of US products, including industrial goods, wine, and spirits, to zero. Sensitive Indian agriculture and dairy sectors remain protected under the deal.

title: 26-year-old fintech startup founder charged with US visa fraud and lying
content: A Turkish tech executive has been indicted for defrauding venture capitalists of $7 million in seed money. Gokce Guven allegedly used false financial statements and fabricated documents to secure investments for her fintech company, Kalder Inc. The proceeds were then used to obtain an O-1A "extraordinary ability" visa through similar misrepresentations.

title: Wings of two aircraft collide at Mumbai airport; both had flyers on board
content: Mumbai Airport witnessed a startling incident Tuesday as the wingtips of a stationary Air India Airbus and a taxiing IndiGo A320 scraped each other. The Air India flight to Coimbatore was delayed due to the contact, which damaged its wingtip.

title: J&K: Sajad Lone pushes for Article 370 in LG‚Äôs speech, Speaker rejects
content: The Speaker further pointed out that granting statehood falls within the domain of the Centre and advised Lone to raise only those issues on which J&K govt is competent to respond or take a decision. Outside the assembly, Lone said four of his other amendments were, however, accepted, including those concerning daily wagers, NLU and condemnation of attacks on Kashmiris outside J&K.

title: UK-India FTA omits several key UK interests: House of Lords report
content: The UK govt did not conclude a bilateral investment treaty, or arrangements in relation to legal services, new market access for financial services, or final arrangements for mutual recognition of professional qualifications, and India did not get ‚Äúas much on the mobility issues as it would have liked‚Äù, the report says.

title: Ann Michael starts Super Bowl week strong with bold workout and confident message
content: Ann Michael Maye kicked off Super Bowl 2026 week with a viral workout post as the Patriots prepare to face the Seahawks. From supporting Drake Maye at key playoff moments to launching her NBC Sports Boston show, Ann‚Äôs rise mirrors New England‚Äôs return to the sport‚Äôs biggest stage.

title: Kayla Nicole draws backlash with comment targeting Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift
content: Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, has always been open about her feelings regarding the Kansas City Chiefs' star player moving on in his life with the billionaire pop star, Taylor Swift. As Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding date approach, it seems Kayla Nicole has made another dig at their romance and high profile relationship. Both Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have stayed silent about this.

title: Dodgers target $400M Cy Young deal with Tigers; Sasaki a key trade piece
content: A potential trade between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Detroit Tigers involves Roki Sasaki for Tarik Skubal. This hypothetical deal highlights the Dodgers' focus on immediate championship contention and the Tigers' long-term roster development. The exchange would significantly alter both pitching staffs, with the Dodgers gaining a proven starter and the Tigers acquiring a young arm with future control.

title: Operation Kiya: Encounter erupts in J&K‚Äôs Udhampur
content: Officials said at least two to three Pakistani terrorists were believed to be trapped within the cordon. The White Knight Corps post stated that a joint team of Counter Insurgency Force Delta, police, and CRPF established contact with the terrorists around 4pm. Earlier, security forces had launched a search operation in Jopher area in Udhampur‚Äôs Ramnagar late Sunday.

title: Train to Pahalgam put on hold for now as J&K govt, MPs flag threat to apple orchards
content: The governing National Conference said the halted proposals include the Bijbehara-Pahalgam railway link and the Pulwama-Shopian railway project. The issue was earlier raised by local farmers, legislators, including Anantnag-Poonch MP Mian Altaf and the opposition PDP leaders. Vaishnaw said there was a demand for three additional railway projects in the region, but these had been kept on hold for now due to the objections raised.

title: India-US trade deal: Some key questions that still remain unanswered
content: India-US trade deal: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal‚Äôs press conference on Tuesday also offered little details, though he was clear that sensitive sectors of agriculture and dairy will continue to be protected.

title: Celina Jaitly opens up on ‚Äòbroken‚Äô 15-year marriage amid divorce from Peter Haag
content: Celina Jaitly, who filed for divorce from her husband Peter Haag in November last year at an Andheri court in Mumbai, has opened up about the reality behind her marriage in a deeply personal social media post. The divorce plea was filed on grounds of domestic violence and abuse, leaving many surprised, especially since Celina had often shared affectionate family moments with Haag and their children online.

title: From tariffs to tailfins: India to scale up US arms and aircraft purchases
content: India has agreed to significantly increase purchases of US petroleum, defense systems, and commercial aircraft, totaling up to $500 billion. This trade deal aims to slash tariffs and deepen economic alignment, particularly in strategic sectors like aviation and defense, reshaping bilateral ties for years to come.

title: Giannis wary of Warriors move amid fears of a repeat 'Durant effect'
content: Speculation surrounding Giannis Antetokounmpo's potential move to the Golden State Warriors faces significant hurdles. Sources suggest the Greek Freak is hesitant to join an aging roster and play under Stephen Curry's shadow, fearing a career path similar to Kevin Durant's. Giannis reportedly prioritizes leading a team with a longer championship window.

title: Controversy in Pakistan! Umpire under fire for Connolly dismissal - Watch
content: Australia‚Äôs 3-0 T20 series loss to Pakistan sparked controversy after replays showed Cooper Connolly was wrongly stumped in the third match. Wicketkeeper Khawaja Nafay broke the stumps with the glove not holding the ball, breaching ICC rules. The error went unchecked, angering fans and raising concerns over umpiring and sportsmanship despite Pakistan‚Äôs dominant win.

title: US trade rep gives some details of pact with India; what he said on agri goods, Russian oil
content: The Trump administration is finalising a trade agreement with India, which will see tariffs on industrial goods fall to zero. While India maintains protections for its agricultural sector, the deal is expected to significantly open up its industrial market. The US is also monitoring India's energy trade, noting opportunities for diversification and increased US product purchases.

title: Gautam's gambit! India has a tailor-made team to win back-to-back T20 World Cups
content: In Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakravarthy, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel, India arguably have the best quartet of bowlers at the T20 World Cup. Not to forget, Kuldeep Yadav might have to wait for his chances and the vastly improved Shivam Dube is no pushover. The Suryakumar Yadav-led team looks dangerous not just on paper but has also walked the talk on the field.

title: Celina Jaitly gets relief as Delhi High Court steps in for brother detained in UAE
content: In a fresh development in the case concerning the detention of Bollywood actor Celina Jaitly‚Äôs brother in the United Arab Emirates, the Delhi High Court on Tuesday directed the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) to facilitate legal representation for Major (Retd.) Vikrant Kumar Jaitly in Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

title: Matt Rempe reveals mental toll of thumb injury rehab with Rangers
content: Rangers forward Matt Rempe battled immense frustration and mental struggles during his recovery from a broken thumb.  Unable to play his physical game, he considered fighting during a blowout loss.  After surgery and rehabilitation, Rempe has returned, aiming to finish the season strong despite mixed results, focusing on regaining his effectiveness on the ice.

title: Bhambri scripts history, becomes first Indian after Bopanna to obtain this rare feat
content: Yuki Bhambri climbed to a career-high world No. 20 in the ATP doubles rankings, becoming the first Indian since Rohan Bopanna to enter the Top 20. The rise follows strong performances, including a solid Australian Open run, a US Open semifinal in 2025, and his maiden ATP 500 title in Dubai.

title: Watch: Boxer loses wig during fight, blames mother's shampoo
content: American boxer Jarrell Miller won his heavyweight bout at Madison Square Garden but lost his toupee mid-fight after taking punches from Kingsley Ibeh. Spotting it come loose, he laughed and threw it into the crowd, then blamed his sudden hair loss on shampoo at his mother‚Äôs house, calling the moment embarrassing but funny.

title: Why Union Budget 2026 avoided populism and chose stability
content: If the past Union Budgets were shaped by tax reforms and progressive personal tax restructuring, then Budget 2026 is more about firefighting and shielding the economy from global shocks, managing uncertainty and rebuilding confidence amid a volatile international environment.

title: From H'wood to hard reality: How a modern 'Fire Sale' would actually work; can India survive it?
content: Once a Hollywood fantasy, a nation's digital paralysis is now a real threat.  Modern states, deeply interconnected, face coordinated cyber, electronic warfare, and information attacks.  This "Fire Sale" concept, unfolding in phases, targets power, communications, and finance, aiming to destabilize before conflict erupts, posing a significant challenge for digitally dependent nations like India.

title: Beyond white and grey: How colours can elevate the look of minimalist homes
content: Minimalist interiors are embracing color to add warmth and personality, moving beyond stark white and grey. Earthy pinks, soothing russet browns, and calming sage green are creating serene yet inviting spaces. Blues offer visual rhythm, while ivory grey provides elegance. Black accents anchor designs, and natural wood tones ground the aesthetic, proving thoughtful color choices enhance minimalist appeal.

title: India‚ÄìUS trade deal: New Delhi may scale back Russian oil buys after tariff relief
content: India will significantly reduce crude oil imports from Russia, adhering to a US-brokered trade deal that lowers tariffs on Indian goods. While existing contracts will be honored, new orders for Russian crude will cease, except for Nayara Energy due to its unique circumstances. This move aims to boost Indian exports and diversify energy sources.

title: Inside China's grey zone activities: How Beijing is salami slicing its way to influence
content: China is employing a 'salami slicing' strategy, taking incremental steps across military, economic, and technological domains to alter realities without triggering conflict. This 'gray zone' approach, evident in the South China Sea and beyond, bypasses international law and exploits rivals' hesitation. The cumulative effect creates new facts on the ground, challenging the existing order.

title: 'India got best deal': Goyal hails trade pact with US; credits PM for protecting farm, dairy sectors
content: Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday described the India‚ÄìUS trade agreement as a ‚Äútremendous opportunity‚Äù for the country, calling it the best deal India has secured compared to its neighbours. Addressing a press conference he said that the pact sends positive signals for the future and will benefit all citizens.

title: SIR showdown: TMC mulls impeachment motion against CEC; Mamata challenges Centre
content: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee announced plans to move an impeachment motion against the Chief Election Commissioner over the Special Intensive Revision process. The party alleges the SIR is flawed and aims to disenfranchise citizens, particularly in opposition-ruled states ahead of elections. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee also criticized the timing and selective application of the SIR.

title: US-Iran tensions: Tehran signals readiness for talks amid Trump's pressure
content: Iran's President Pezeshkian has ordered talks with the US, seeking an environment free from threats and unreasonable expectations, focusing on national interests. This comes amid heightened regional tensions and a warning from President Trump about potential "bad things."  Tehran insists negotiations must center on the nuclear issue, not defense capabilities.

title: A do-over of the 2025 NFL draft: Let's redraft the first 64 picks, with changes starting at No. 2
content: Abdul Carter to the Jets? Tyler Shough to the Browns? Emeka Egbuka to the 49ers? We repicked the first two rounds of last year's NFL draft.

content: The Celtics added some much-needed frontcourt help, acquiring Nikola Vucevic from the Bulls for Anfernee Simons and a second-round draft pick, sources told ESPN.

title: NFLPA: Players 'have no appetite' for 18th game
content: NFL Players Association leadership made it clear Tuesday that the players aren't in support of an expanded regular-season schedule.

content: The Grizzlies are trading star forward Jaren Jackson Jr. to the Jazz as part of an eight-player deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Huerter to Pistons, Ivey to Bulls in 3-team trade
content: Chicago, Minnesota and Detroit have agreed to a trade that sends Jaden Ivey and Mike Conley to the Bulls and Kevin Huerter and Dario Saric to the Pistons, sources told ESPN.

title: Boxer G. Davis facing new warrant in Baltimore
content: An arrest order has been issued in Baltimore for boxer Gervonta Davis, stemming from an alleged probation violation following his recent arrest in Miami.

content: The Warriors have involved Draymond Green in active trade conversation in advance of Thursday's NBA trade deadline, league sources told ESPN.

title: CFP moves off NYE in '26 to avoid conflict with NFL

content: Falcons president of football Matt Ryan would not commit Tuesday to Michael Penix Jr. being the team's starting quarterback.

content: Shakur Stevenson is the top-ranked fighter in two divisions following a dominant win over Teofimo Lopez Jr. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

content: The Enforcement Directorate has secured conviction in 43 PMLA cases since 2020-21, wherein 104 accused have been convicted

title: Air India plane flown afterphysical checks, no abnormal parameters noticed: DGCA
content: The fuel control switch of the left engine of the Dreamliner aircraft VT-ANX, which operated the flight AI132 that had more than 200 people on board, did not latch on the 'RUN' position twice during the engine start at London Heathrow airport, but was properly locked in the 'RUN' position on the third attempt

title: 16th Finance Commission points to regressive free power benefits in Tamil Nadu
content: Power subsidies flow disproportionately to higher consumption households. Over 2.3 crore consumers enjoy free electricity up to 100 units bimonthly, regardless of level of consumption

title: Case against West Bengal SIR: Mamata Banerjee likely to appear in person in Supreme Court on February 4
content: A batch of petitions challenging the constitutionality of the SIR process and the mass exclusion of electors from the voters‚Äô list of the State is listed for hearing on February 4, 2026

title: India-U.S. trade deal: Agri, seafood exporters relieved, farmers agitated over possible import of U.S. crops
content: Lower tariffs to help seafood exporters recover ground, says industry group; SKM says allowing 0% import tariffs on U.S. goods is a surrender to U.S. imperialism that will devastate Indian farmers

title: BIFFes 2026: Women directors call for cinema beyond the male gaze
content: At the Bengaluru International Film Festival, filmmakers Jacqueline Roussety, Sindhu Sreenivasa Murthy and Nidhi Saxena tackled the frustrating double standards in how films portray men and women

title: Drop in KIA‚Äôs domestic passenger numbers in December 2025 due to IndiGo crisis
content: Kempegowda International Airport handled 3,133,697 passengers in December 2025, compared to 3,279,765 passengers in November 2025

title: Tremors felt across Kolkata, adjacent areas as quake hits Myanmar
content: A section of residents in high-rise buildings and office employees said they experienced the aftershocks of the quake, which struck Myanmar at around 9.04 p.m. IST and lasted for a few seconds.

title: A.P. to set up palliative centres in all teaching hospitals in State, says Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says the government is also considering the idea of expanding cancer care services to every district headquarters; notes that the number of cancer cases has seen gradual increase in Andhra Pradesh from 25,487 in 2020 to 35,546 in 2025

title: Transform A.P. into largest natural farming hub, CM tells officials
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to develop a Cocoa City over 500 acres in Eluru district; announces that registration of aquaculture activities will be made mandatory; suggests organising crop-festivals in various regions to promote awareness of different crops and boost tourism

title: ED raids several places in West Bengal over coal smuggling scam
content: Residence of a businessman and a police officer was searched during the raids with cash seized from the premises

title: Opposition MPs in Rajya Sabha question Centre over India-U.S. trade deal
content: Leaders urge Centre to ensure deal does not affect farmers seek clarification on U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs announcements over India‚Äôs oil purchases

title: Ancient temple in Nellore to get new lease of life
content: Endowments department sanctions 1.50 crore from CGF funds to develop the nearly 200-year-old Nageswara Swamy temple, which was unearthed near Penna riverbank in Perumallapadu village

title: I am not in the race for NCP national president:  Praful Patel
content: Patel, the NCP‚Äôs working president, meets Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah; newly sworn-in Deputy CM Sunetra Pawar will meet the duo after the Maharashtra Cabinet meets on February 10

title: Jama Masjid closed, Mirwaz placed under house arrest ahead of Shab-e-Barat prayers:¬†Anjuman Auqaf

content: Opposition has alleged that there is corruption to the tune of ‚Çπ 6,000 crore in the Excise Department

title: GSI to probe land subsidence in Godavari delta in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Water Resource Department has roped in the experts to fix the scientific reasons for the land subsidence, factors for the defunct 350-long irrigation drains in the Central Delta thriving with oil and natural gas exploration activities.

title: Government signs MoU to establish Bharat Container Shipping Line
content: The Bharat Container Shipping Line will anchor India‚Äôs container trade in Indian hands and strengthen our strategic and commercial presence in global maritime trade, the minister said

title: Economic empowerment of women key to self-reliance: Minister
content: Kerala State Women‚Äôs Development Corporation‚Äôs Escalera 2026, a women‚Äôs fest, begins at Kanakakkunnu

title: Kerala being punished for not accepting BJP: Pinarayi
content: Congress is acting like BJP‚Äôs B-team and is remaining silent even as the Union govt. is financially choking the State, says Chief Minister

title: UDF finalising candidate list for Kottayam ahead of Statewide rally
content: The UDF aims to finalise candidates, aligning with Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan‚Äôs rally on February 24. Amid ongoing seat-sharing disputes, particularly in Changanassery and Ettumanur, UDF leaders are prioritising candidates with community support to reclaim lost seats.

title: India-U.S. trade deal will not include sensitive agricultural items and dairy: Goyal
content: The Commerce and Industry Minister says the deal would benefit all of India‚Äôs labour-intensive exporting sectors; blames Opposition for not making statement in Parliament; joint India-U.S. note awaited¬†

title: Ex-corporators threaten agitation if e‚ÄëKhata software glitches aren‚Äôt fixed within a week
content: The former mayer points out that technical glitches have repeatedly marred the e-Khata system ever since it was introduced over six months ago

title: SFI leaders ‚Äòabducted‚Äô in Tirupati
content: The leaders were on their way to the Collectorate to join the protest against alleged irregularities of Mohan Babu University, when nearly 30 persons reportedly attacked SFI district general secretary S. Akbar and the federation‚Äôs SVU students‚Äô union leader Vinod

title: West Bengal BJP admits harassment of voters during SIR; blames poll officials, TMC
content: BJP MLAs submit memo to Governor claiming a section of EROS, AEROs, BLOs are making ‚Äúdeliberate‚Äù mistakes during SIR, issuing notices to harass people, in collusion with Trinamool Congress and I-PAC

content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the interim order on a writ appeal filed by a disqualified bidder

title: Markapuram district to get Collectorate building soon
content: District administration is planning to convert a school building into Collector office at Goguladinne village in Markapuram mandal

content: The Bangladeshi nationals failed to produce a passport, visa or any other valid travel document. They also confessed that they came to India in a clandestine manner

title: Driving Licence suspension recommended for serious traffic violations
content: Traffic violations warranting suspension include over speeding and jumping traffic signals, carrying excess load in goods vehicles or transporting passengers in goods carriages, driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs, and using mobile phones while driving

title: Tamil Nadu gears up for Census  2027; house-listing likely to start after Assembly election
content: Chief Secretary N.¬†Muruganandam¬†chaired the first meeting of the State-level coordination committee at the Secretariat on Monday (February 2, 2026). About 1.5¬†lakh¬†officials, including enumerators and supervisors, are expected to take part in the exercise in Tamil Nadu

title: Supreme Court grants interim bail to former Chhattisgarh Minister in two liquor scam cases
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant granted the interim relief after considering the fact that Kawasi Lakhma had been in jail since his arrest by ED on January 15 last year on money laundering charges

title: KC(M) bets big on LDF central zone rally, puts to rest defection rumours
content: The Kerala Congress (M) is set to launch its central zone rally from Aranmula on February 6, culminating in Ernakulam on February 14, as it seeks to reinforce its commitment to the Left Democratic Front (LDF). Led by Jose K. Mani, the rally will traverse key towns in Central Kerala, showcasing the party‚Äôs strategic importance in the region while seeking to solidify support among coastal Christian communities.

title: How 'The Matrix' foreshadowed Jeffrey Epstein saga
content: Nirmalya Dutta is an editorial consultant with The Times of India. He covers world news, pop culture, and philosophical memes. He writes the column Random Musings and The Weekly Vine, a newsletter that blends news, culture, and humour with a touch of chaos. He is also the co-creator of Meow Times, a satirical cartoon strip about the absurdities of corporate life. His political, moral, and economic views drift somewhere between woke-Leninist, Rand-Marxist, and Keynesian-Friedmanite, though he isn‚Äôt entirely sure what any of those terms mean. Read More

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Beno√Æt Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: 2 Nigerians Arrested For Cheating Employees In Gurugram: Cops
content: Two Nigerian nationals have been arrested for allegedly extorting around Rs 10 lakh from employees of a company by posing as its directors, police said on Tuesday.

title: Late Libyan Leader Muammar Gaddafi's Son Killed By Armed Gang
content: The most prominent son of late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, has been killed, sources close to the family, his lawyer Khaled el-Zaydi and Libyan media said on Tuesday.

title: S Jaishankar Meets Scott Bessent, Discusses Strengthening India-US Economic Ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday met US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent in Washington DC as part of an ongoing three-day visit to the United States.

title: S Jaishankar Meets US Secretary Of State Marco Rubio In Washington
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington on Tuesday ahead of an inaugural ministerial on critical minerals.

title: ChatGPT Down For Thousands Of Users In US: Report
content: ChatGPT was down for thousands of users in the US on Tuesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: Former US First Lady Jill Biden's Ex-Husband Charged With Killing Wife
content: The first husband of former first lady Jill Biden has been charged with killing his wife at their Delaware home in late December, authorities announced in a news release Tuesday.

title: 2019 Email Shows Noam Chomsky Advised Epstein To Avoid Media "Vultures"
content: Renowned American intellectual Noam Chomsky privately sympathized with Jeffrey Epstein over what he described as the "horrible way" the press treated the late sex offender, urging him in a 2019 email to lie low and avoid media "vultures."

title: Businessmen, Car Owners Among Ration Card Beneficiaries In Delhi: MLA
content: A verification drive into Delhi's ration card system has thrown up startling gaps - from cards issued in the names of the dead to beneficiaries earning well above eligibility limits, with over two lakh ration cards flagged as irregular.

title: Spain Seeks Social Media Ban For Children Below 16
content: Spain will seek to ban social media for under-16s to protect them from harmful content such as pornography and violence, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Tuesday, in the latest such move by governments.

title: From India To Canada's Far North: New Archbishop Serves Indigenous Catholics
content: As a teenager in southern India, Susai Jesu led 4:30 a.m. prayer services in his small Catholic village before the farmers went into the fields. He directed the choir, helped at Mass and soon began training for the priesthood.

title: Fact Check: Viral Images Of Zohran Mamdani With Epstein Are AI-Generated
content: Multiple AI-generated photos falsely claiming to show New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani as a child and his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair, with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: US Tanker Approached By Iranian Gunboats In Strait Of Hormuz
content: British maritime security firm Vanguard Tech said Tuesday that a US-flagged tanker was approached and challenged by Iranian gunboats in the Strait of Hormuz before continuing on its way.

title: France Ditches Zoom, Teams as Europe Seeks Digital Autonomy From US
content: In France, civil servants will ditch Zoom and Teams for a homegrown video conference system. Soldiers in Austria are using open source office software to write reports after the military dropped Microsoft Office.

title: 450 Drones, 70 Missiles:  Russia's Biggest Attack On Ukraine's Power Grid
content: Russia fired around 450 long-range drones and 70 missiles of various types at Ukraine in a major attack overnight, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Tuesday.

title: Grok Creates Sexualised Images Even When Told Subjects Don't Consent: Report
content: Elon Musk's flagship artificial intelligence chatbot, Grok, continues to generate sexualised images of people even when users explicitly warn that the subjects do not consent, Reuters has found.

title: Wingtips Of 2 Planes Touch On Runway In Mumbai, Passengers Safe
content: The wingtips of two passenger aircraft came in contact while taxiing at Mumbai airport today, the aviation regulator DGCA said in a statement.

title: 2 British Tourists Get 'Leave India' Notice Over 'Free Palestine' Stickers
content: A British couple was directed to leave India after they pasted stickers in support of Palestine against Israel at various public locations in Rajasthan's Ajmer.

title: Girl, 14, Survives Night Alone In Forest After Kidnapping, Attempted Rape
content: A disturbing incident has been reported from Odisha's Kandhamal district, where a 14-year-old girl allegedly survived a night alone in a forest after being abducted and assaulted. Police have arrested one accused, while a search is on for the second.

title: Railways Halts 3 Rail Projects To Protect Apple Orchards In Kashmir
content: The Centre has put off three proposed railway projects in Kashmir to save apple orchards that were being impacted due to the proposed rail lines.

title: Boyfriend Blocks Her Calls And Messages, Woman Stabs Him To Death
content: A shocking and sensational murder has shaken Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur after a young woman allegedly stabbed her boyfriend to death during a heated argument over being blocked on his mobile phone.

title: State of MLB: Has the Dodgers' dominance propelled the NL past the AL?
content: the national league was founded in 1876 by the Chicago White Stockings officer . it was a loose affiliation of clubs that had problems with competitive balance . in 1901, the American League declared itself a competitor to the NL, jumping up from its minor league status .
